author: Adunni Amodeni
title: I prefer to remain in prison - Maid confesses after stealing her boss N2m (photo) ▷ NAIJ.COM
text: Just recently in Lagos, a 26-year-old housemaid, Marry Atte, who was arrested and charged before Isolo Magistrate court for stealing her boss’ N2m, has refused to leave the prison. Arrested housemaid, Mary Atte She explained in the open court that the prison condition was far better for her than when she was outside and would continue to remain there for her comfort, as this left everyone in shock. P.M News disclosed that, when the Magistrate set her free, she became angry and protested openly in court that she was going back to prison and she actually went back as she said. Before she joined the bus back to the prison, Atte added that she was brought to Lagos from her village in Benue state by her sister she simply called Esther. PAY ATTENTION: Get all the latest gossips on NAIJ Gossip App The lady disclosed that, she was arrested and taken to prison on December 20, 2016, before she was charged to court for allegedly stealing her boss’ money which she denied. Esther sent her to one man as house help where she served for some months and the man did not pay her the agreed salary. She said she left the place and went to another man’s house, one Aneke Andrew’s house at John Ije close at Okota as maid and served for some time before Andrew came with another story and did not pay her. She said when the time reached for the man to pay her, he alleged that she stole his dollars valued over N2m. Read full story HERE .
